svcproc.title: PROPER IDENTIFICATION AND GEAR PATTERN FOR THE NEW SPICER "CONTINUOUS INDEX" CUT GEAR SETS FOR W230-S (CODE 14057) AND W460-S (CODE 14474) REAR AXLES
svcproc.para: Due to today's production requirements, Spicer Heavy Axle has phased in ring and pinion gear sets that use different manufacturing methods than the conventional gear sets.

The new sets are called "Continuous Index Cut Gears." The new gear sets are a direct replacement for the conventional cut gears, therefore it was not necessary to assign new part numbers for the matched sets. The "Continuous Index" gear sets do, however, require building with a different tooth contact pattern than the conventional gear sets, so positive identification was necessary to distinguish continuous index gear sets from the conventional.

The individual Continuous gears were assigned new part numbers that will be used to properly identify them. The first 5 digits of the pinion gear part number are 057GP, followed by a 3 number suffix to indicate ration. The first 5 digits of the ring gear part number are 057GR. The illustration ( Figure 1) shows location of individual part numbers.

warning.para: GEAR FAILURE WILL OCCUR TO BOTH CONTINUOUS INDEX OR CONVENTIONAL GEAR SETS IF PROPER TOOTH CONTACT PATTERN IS NOT ESTABLISHED FOR EITHER SET.

svcproc.para: The following procedures are to be used to establish proper gear tooth pattern after assembly of the carrier is complete.

note.para: If matched sets are being reused, measure and record backlash before disassembly, and reassemble to the same backlash. This will match ring and pinion gears to the established wear patterns. Hand rolled patterns of pre-used gear sets will cover less area than the wear pattern established by previous service.

step1.para: Paint ring gear with marking compound on both the drive and coast side. ( Figure 2)
Rotate ring gear at least one complete revolution in both directions while load is being applied.
